hero.title: Free Online JSON Editor - No Ads
hero.p1: BriJson is a free online JSON editor designed for developers who need a fast, efficient tool with no intrusive advertising. Unlike other JSON viewers cluttered with ads, BriJson offers you a clean and professional experience.

why.title: Why choose our free online JSON editor?
why.li1: 100% Free: All features available at no cost
why.li2: No ads: Work without distractions or annoying banners
why.li3: No tracking: Your privacy matters, we donâ€™t track your data
why.li4: Real-time JSON validator: Detects syntax errors instantly
why.li5: Format and minify JSON: Optimize your files with a single click
why.li7: Interactive editing: Modify values, add and delete properties
why.li8: Integrated search: Find keys and values quickly

features.title: Features of the Online JSON Editor
features.p1: Our free online JSON editor includes all the tools you need to work with JSON files: syntax validation, auto formatting, minification, hierarchical tree view, interactive node editing, content search, file statistics and much more. All of this without ads and completely free.

devtool.title: JSON Tool for Developers
devtool.p1: Perfect for developers, programmers, API designers and anyone working with JSON data. Supports JSON files of any size, with syntax highlighting, automatic first-level expansion, and an intuitive interface that speeds up your workflow.

tip.html: ðŸ’¡ Tip: Use Ctrl/Cmd + V to paste your JSON directly into the editor and start working right away. No signup, no downloads, no ads.

edit.title: How to edit and add nodes and values
edit.p1: In the tree view you can edit values, rename properties and add/remove nodes using double-click or the context menu.

steps.title: Quick steps
steps.li1: Click a node in the tree to select it.
steps.li2: Edit a value with a double-click or choose Edit value from the context menu.
steps.li3: To add, open the context menu and choose Add property (for objects) or Add item (for arrays).
steps.li4: Use Rename to change a property name (not available for array items).
steps.li5: Use Delete to remove the selected node (with confirmation).
steps.li6: Save your changes with the modal Save button.

actions.title: Available actions
actions.li1: Edit value, edit name (properties), copy path or copy value.
actions.li2: Add property (object) or item (array) with supported types: string, number, boolean, null, object, array.
actions.li3: Delete nodes with confirmation to prevent mistakes.

tips.title: Tips
tips.li2: The validator helps detect syntax errors before formatting or minifying.
tips.li3: Use Copy JSON to take the result to your clipboard.
tips.li4: Enable tree Fullscreen to work more comfortably with large JSON files.

edit.note: Note: Changes are applied to the JSON in your browser memory. We don't upload files to any server. To keep your work, copy the JSON or download the file from your editor.

searchGuide.title: How to search in JSON
searchGuide.p1: The search finds matches in keys and values across the entire JSON. It's case-insensitive by default and traverses nested structures.

how.title: How it works
how.li1: As you type, it searches for matches in property names and values.
how.li2: If a result is inside collapsed nodes, the tree automatically expands to reveal it.
how.li3: Matches are highlighted and you can navigate with the Next button.
how.li4: Navigation is sequential; when reaching the end it wraps to the beginning.

tips.title: Tips
tips.li1: Use the Next button to jump between matches.
tips.li2: If you don't see results, check spelling or try part of the term.
tips.li3: Combine with Expand All to explore large structures.

searchGuide.note: Note: Search is case-insensitive by default. It searches in both keys and values, including numbers and booleans.
